title: Product Manager II, Backup and Disaster Recovery
description: At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 4 years of experience in product management, consulting, co-founder, or a related technical role. 2 years of experience building and shipping technical products. Experience in building enterprise software products.
preferred_qualifications: 8 years of experience in product management building enterprise software products. Experience with Kubernetes and backup. Experience in one or more of the following: data protection, disaster recovery, storage, Relational Databases (Postgres, MYSQL), No-SQL Databases (Cassandra, MongoDB ), messaging queues (Kafka) and K-V stores (Redis) and storage technologies (block/file/object/CSI). Experience managing day-to-day technical and design direction. Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, or Marketing. Familiarity with cloud native applications development platforms.
responsibilities: Define and launch features and drive customer adoption for GCP data protection products specifically backup for Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) service. Drive strategy, direction, and execution for Kubernetes workload data protection. Define product requirements for new features and develop Product Requirements Documents (PRDs). Partner with product managers from other parts of GCP (e.g., storage, databases, Google Kubernetes Engine) to solve customer use cases. Drive adoption and business by partnering with marketing, business, support and partner account teams.
